What is SSR? ​. Vue.js is a framework for building client-side applications. By default, Vue components produce and manipulate DOM in the browser as output.
Server-side Rendering (SSR). Also referred to as "SSR" or "Dynamic Rendering". If a page uses Server-side Rendering, the page HTML is generated on each request.
Server-side rendering (SSR) is a process that involves rendering pages on the server, resulting in initial HTML content which contains initial page state.
Note. SSR specifically refers to front-end frameworks (for example React, Preact, Vue, and Svelte) that support running the same application in Node.js, ...
Server-side rendering pre-renders your JavaScript pages on the server, allowing your visitors to receive fully rendered HTML when they visit your application.
SSR will continue to produce the speciality wheels it will be able to respond any requests from the motor fan all over the world.
